page.title: 01Winchfield Area - Landscape.
page.content: The block is largely rural and is traversed from north to south by the {River Hart.}In general terms about a quarter of the block is wooded, just over half is farmland and the remainder consists of routeways and residential areas. From east to west the block is traversed by the{M3 {motorway}and the{London to Southampton {Railway.}To the south of the block is a 2 km section of the recently restored{Basingstoke Canal}so in just twelve square kilometres we have examples from three transport revolutions. Although the block verges on the suburbs of the commuter town of {Fleet}its residential areas are nearly all tiny hamlets, namely {Winchfield}and{Winchfield Hurst}and parts of{Phoenix Green, Chatter Alley, {Bagwell Green, Rotten Green}and {Elvetham.
